column4: ok since the guided partition doesn't work becuase it only sees my xp partition i have to use the manual and i see /dev/sda1 ntsf /dev/sda2 ext3 106MB and /dev/sda3 31gb  which sda2 and sda3 must be linux how do i format them onto one partition and install ubuntu
well, it seems like /dev/sda2 is /boot and /dev/sda3 might be /
what do you wnat to do?
you want to install ubuntu over XP?
well for starters: ubuntu IS linux, but well you should delete /dev/sda2 and /dev/sda3 via livecd
then use the installer and manually create 3 partitions: 1) ext2 100MB for /boot 2) ext3 about 5GB for / 3) ext3 the rest for /home
could use ext3 though. but i don't see the need for a journaled fs on /boot
but you should ALWAYS make backups dude
guided is bad... it screwed my disk once
use manual: just check that there's no checked box on /dev/sda1
do i use primary or logical for the new partitions
use primary for /boot. the rest is logical
short: primary : max 4 partitions logical: more.... long: see wikipedia
